title-group.article-title: ODD PERFECT NUMBERS, DIOPHANTINE EQUATIONS, AND UPPER BOUNDS

abstract.p: We obtain a new upper bound for odd multiperfect numbers. If N is an odd perfect number with k distinct prime divisors and P is its largest prime divisor, we find as a corollary that ${10}^{12}{\mathrm{P}}^{2}\mathrm{N}<{2}^{{4}^{\mathrm{k}}}$. Using this new bound, and extensive computations, we derive the inequality k ≥ 10.
